name: Nut and Fruit Bread
author: Carol
summary: This is another great holiday bread to make that belonged to my mother.  She sometimes served this one, and it is a very old recipe.  This bread is good the first day, but better the second. You may use dates instead of raisins if you wish.
directions: Grease an 8 x 5 inch loaf tin thoroughly
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
In a small bowl, beat the egg well
Mix in milk and melted butter or shortening
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together into a mixing bowl
Add sugar, nuts, raisins and orange rind; mix well
Blend egg mixture into fruit and nut mixture until flour is just moistened
Turn batter into greased loaf tin, and allow to stand for 20 minutes
Place pan in the center of the oven
Turn bread out on wire rack, and cool for several hours before slicing
